DataElement.preferredName: Imaging Technique Observation Performed Study Activity Duration ISO21090.PQ.TIME.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The completed action of obtaining pictures of the interior or exterior of the body usually for diagnostic reasons. EXAMPLE(S): X-ray, MRI, etc The period of time over which the activity is performed.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Imaging Technique Observation Performed Study Activity Duration
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective._The period of time during which something continues.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Imaging Technique Observation Performed Study Activity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:Executed and carried through to completion.:A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.:An action taken in pursuit of an objective.

Concepts.definition: Any technology or method that aids in the visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for use in screening, diagnosis, surgical procedures or therapy.
Watching something and taking note of what happens.
Executed and carried through to completion.
A detailed examination, analysis, or critical inspection of a subject designed to discover facts about it.
An active process; excludes processes and mechanisms which fulfill biological functions.

Property.preferredDefinition: The period of time during which something continues.

Concepts.definition: The period of time during which something continues.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Default Conceptual Domain for UML Loader

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Constrains PQ to have units that describe a period of time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Health Informatics - Harmonized data types for information interchange

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happened. (NCI)

Concepts.definition: An expression of both date and time that an event has happened or will happen.
